page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: Most farmers in Chardstock are Dairy Farmers.Some but very few are Beef farmers.Much of the land in Chardstock is used by the farmers for their cattle.Crops grown on farms include- hay,silage,maize,wheat,barley swedes and potatoes.Through the years machinery has changed,todays milking is done by machines long ago it was done by hand and took a long time,now it takes less time.Harvesting machines are now drawn by Tractors and not pulled by horses.Many years ago crops were sown by hand now it is done by machines,and fields are ploughed by machines too.In Chardstock there are roughly 12 small farmers with approx 80 acres some owned some rented.In the Winter cows sleep in cubicals with Hay for feed and straw for bedding.In late spring early summer farmers cut grass for Hay and silage & store it in pits.
